result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark J Herrian was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Effective upon licensure.  Attached is an information sheet for the defendant regarding installation.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and safety plan.

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark J Herrian

Def in person & by Atty Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1, Court dismissed Count 2 for read-in,  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and enters judgment.
Exhibit #1
Hearing at 11-10-2015 09:45 am

Def in person & by Atty Wilfred P. De Junco.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  WITNESS:  Officer Jennifer Gerke (JPD).  Argument by counsel.  Court finds the State has met its burden, this is a close case, and believe there is sufficient evidence to constitute reasonable suspicion and therefore does deny the Defense Stop Motion.  Counsel believes the case will resolve at the next appearance.  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Court finds probable cause on the 2nd count of the Information.  Counsel request to not enter plea today.  Arraignment scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Wilfred P. De Junco.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper and Samuel Tufford appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel advises still awaiting blood test results.   Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  State believes the crime lab is down an analyst and believes takes up to 60 days for results.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  SPD will represent.  State request $1,000.00 cash bond, counsel request $750.00 cash bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 09:45 am.
